intro: Randia oxyodonta var. microdonta, commonly known as the small-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
